oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bovine endometritis: Comparative efficacy of alfaprostol and intrauterine therapies, and other factors influencing clinical success
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Murray, R. D.
Allison, J. D.
Gard, R. P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine endometritis
alfaprostol
intrauterine
antibacterial preparation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A comparative study of the treatment of 306 severe, moderate, or mild cases of bovine endometritis was carried out over two calving seasons. The cases were treated with alfaprostol, or an intrauterine antibacterial preparation, or with a combination of both therapies. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1990) 127, 86-90
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1990; 132
